citations.narrative:
The following housekeeping issues were noted during the inspection of the animal housing room. The pigs were housed
in enclosures with solid back walls made of painted concrete blocks and with side and front walls made of metal fencing.
Many of the enclosures were noted to have a build-up of large-sized cobwebs and particulate debris on the surface of the
back walls, on the side/front walls, on the water pipes mounted on the walls, and on the overhead light fixtures. There was
a dark colored material present on the surfaces of the lower half of the metal fencing walls of the majority of the occupied
pens.
Per this Section, premises housing animals shall be kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices and to
protect the health of the animals. The housing room, the walls of the enclosures, and the light fixtures need to be cleaned
and the level of housekeeping in the area needs to be improved to facilitate prescribed housekeeping practices and for
the health of the animals.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The following housekeeping issues were noted during the inspection of the animal housing room. The pigs were housed 
in enclosures with solid back walls made of painted concrete blocks and with side and front walls made of metal fencing. 
Many of the enclosures were noted to have a build-up of large-sized cobwebs and particulate debris on the surface of the 
back walls, on the side/front walls, on the water pipes mounted on the walls, and on the overhead light fixtures. There was 
a dark colored material present on the surfaces of the lower half of the metal fencing walls of the majority of the occupied 
pens. 
 
Per this Section, premises housing animals shall be kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices and to 
protect the health of the animals. The housing room, the walls of the enclosures, and the light fixtures need to be cleaned 
and the level of housekeeping in the area needs to be improved to facilitate prescribed housekeeping practices and for 
the health of the animals. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.  
 
*END OF REPORT* 
 
 n
